sourcesContent:
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core'; import { CodingChallenge } from '../../../../models/coding-challenge.model'; @Component({ selector: 'app-question-tabs', standalone: false, templateUrl: './question-tabs.html', styleUrl: './question-tabs.scss' }) export class QuestionTabs { tabs: string[] = ['Description', 'Examples', 'Hints', 'Solution']; activeTab: string = 'Description'; @Input() challenge: CodingChallenge = { id: 'two-sum', title: 'Two Sum', slug: 'two-sum', description: ` Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. You can return the answer in any order. `, difficulty: 'Easy', category: 'Array', acceptance: 87.6, likes: 1245, languageTemplates: { python: `def twoSum(nums, target):\n pass`, javascript: `function twoSum(nums, target) {\n // your code\n}` }, sampleInput: 'nums = [2,7,11,15], target = 9', sampleOutput: '[0,1]', constraints: ` • 2 ≤ nums.length ≤ 10⁴ • -10⁹ ≤ nums[i] ≤ 10⁹ • -10⁹ ≤ target ≤ 10⁹ • Only one valid answer exists. `, hints: [ 'Try using a hash map to store seen numbers.', 'Can you solve it in one pass?' ] }; }

{{ challenge.title }}

{{ challenge.difficulty }}
📂 Category: {{ challenge.category }}
📈 Acceptance: {{ challenge.acceptance }}%
👍 Likes: {{ challenge.likes }}

📝 Description

{{ challenge.description }}

📏 Constraints

{{ challenge.constraints }}

📌 Example

Input: {{ challenge.sampleInput }}
Output: {{ challenge.sampleOutput }}

💡 Hints

🧠 Solution Template

{{ challenge.languageTemplates['python'] || '// Solution not available for this language' }}
